article:
'Vascular' in zoology and medicine means "related to blood vessels", which are
part of the circulatory system. Its origin is in the Latin word vasculum,
meaning little vessel. http://www.thefreedictionary.com/vascular

The vascular system is a network of blood vessels; arteries, veins and
capillaries, that carry blood to organs around the body. An organ or tissue that
is vascularized is heavily endowed with blood vessels and thus richly supplied
with blood.

In botany, plants with a dedicated transport system for water and nutrients are
called vascular plants. Vascular plants include ferns, gymnosperms and flowering
plants. A vascular bundle is part of such a transport system.
